capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I think Harry's wand is a really special thing. It's like an extension of himself, you know? He chose it himself and it's been with him through so much. I mean, can you imagine going up against Voldemort without that trusty wand by your side? It's just incredible to think about how much power and magic it holds.

You know, I think Harry's wand is a really special part of his story. It's an incredible magical artifact that plays such a big role in the wizarding world. I mean, can you imagine being able to cast spells with just a flick of your wrist? It's truly amazing. And I think it's also interesting how the wand chooses the wizard, rather than the other way around. Anyway, I've always been fascinated by the history and significance of wands in the Harry Potter series.
